intro: Lisianthius speciosus, commonly known as the showy lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, making it visually striking. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting well to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Lisianthius speciosus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
